title: Exhaust Silencer - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
Exhaust Silencer removal DB4; DBB; DT4; DTB; DTC; DU4; DUB; DUC
Always note the position and orientation of the exhaust clamps prior to releasing them, and return them to the noted position and orientation on assembly.
Release the clamps securing the silencers to the catalytic converter link pipe.
Note the position of the washers and rubber bushes in the footrest hanger for installation.
Remove the rear fixing securing the silencer to the frame. Discard the lock nut.
Silencer clamp fixing (left hand side shown)
Note the position of the rear foot peg detent plate and ball bearing for installation.
Remove the E-clip, clevis pin and foot peg from its mounting.

body.name: Remove E clip from foot peg cjdd

body.body: Note the position of the washers and rubber bushes in the silencer mounting for installation.
Support the silencer, remove the rear foot peg mounting and remove the silencer. Discard the lock nut.

body.name: Rear foot peg mounting removal cjde

body.body: Remove and discard the exhaust gasket.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DBB; DUC; DTB; DUB; DTC; DU4; DT4; DB4
